definitions.definition: To make a threat against someone; to use threats.
examples: He threatened me with a knife.
The rocks threatened the ship's survival.

definitions.definition: To portend , or give a warning of.
examples: The black clouds threatened heavy rain.

definitions.definition: To call into question the validity of (a belief, idea, or viewpoint); to challenge.
examples: The new information threatened our original hypothesis.

definitions.definition: To be close to equaling or surpassing (a record, etc.)

main_definition: To make a threat against someone; to use threats.
secondary_definitions: To portend , or give a warning of.
To call into question the validity of (a belief, idea, or viewpoint); to challenge.
( figuratively ) To be close to equaling or surpassing (a record, etc.)
